title: How did J.K. Rowling create character names? - Quora

response.answer_text: In nearly every case, etymology is destiny. Rowling thought of the meaning she wanted to convey and then looked for a name with that meaning. Remus, Lupin, Fenrir and Greyback are all connected with “wolf”. Justin, Ernest, Severus are all character-qualities. Lily is a flower associated with purity and death. Poppy is a flower connected with medicine (opiates). Fleur Delacour is “flower of the court”. Crookshanks is “crooked legs”. Weasley is “weasel meadow”, the weasel being a red-furred animal. Mundungus is a nasty-smelling tobacco. Hagrid is a slang-word for a stomach-ache. Bottom means “courage” so the Longbottom family are long in bottom - courageous. But some of the names are derived from famous people, and it’s the namesake rather than the literal meaning that is important. Gilderoy was a romantic highwayman. St Hedwig was the patron saint of orphans. Sirius is the dog-star. Hermione means “belonging to Hermes”, the god of language; she also had a jealous husband.
